member.summary: Gets area of the compressed part of the section.
member.returns:
Returns area of concrete in compression.

member.remarks: Section returned is reduced by holes due to the reinforcement in compression. Unit depends to the units used to define concrete, steel, geometry and internal forces.

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.RCSolver.GetNeutralAxisAngle
member.summary: Gets the angle between the neutral axis normal and the x-axis
member.returns:
Returns angle between the vector perpendicular to neutral axis and the x-axis.
The sense of the vector indicate direction to the most tension fiber.
Unit: [dimensionless].
member.exception: Calculation are not performed.

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.RCSolver.GetNeutralAxisDistance
member.summary: Gets the distance from the concrete section gravity center to neutral axis.
member.returns:
Returns distance from gravity center of contour to neutral axis.
Unit: [length].
member.remarks:
Neutral axis divides the part of the compression from the tension.
This is line where the strain changes sign.
Unit depends to the units used to define concrete, steel, geometry and internal forces.
member.exception: Calculation are not performed.

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.RCSolver.GetStress(Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.ResultType,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets stress at a given point.
member.param: Determines which type of stress to be returned: for rebar or concrete only.
Id of the contour or a given rebar.
member.returns:
Returns the stress in concrete or rebar at point given by contour or rebar Id.
Unit: [force per length^2]
member.remarks:
This method could be used only for concrete and rebars, for section, this method throws exception.
If calculation are not performed, this method throws exception as well.
Unit depends to the units used to define concrete, steel, geometry and internal forces.
member.exception: Calculation are not performed
This method could be used only for concrete and rebars.
Index must be less than Count.

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.RCSolver.SolveForces(Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.ResultType,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates forces according to acting strain
member.param: Determines which type of resistance to be returned: for rebar, concrete or equivalent section (transformed).

Maximum strain in the concrete section.
Unit: [dimensionless].

Minimum strain in the concrete section.
Unit: [dimensionless].

Angle between the vector perpendicular to neutral axis and the x-axis.
The sense of the vector indicate the direction to the most tensioned fiber.
Unit: [dimensionless].
member.remarks:
The resistance forces could be read by GetInternalForces method.
Other information about state of failure could be read using dedicated methods.
The units should be consistent for concrete, steel, geometry and internal forces.
member.exception: Minimum strain greater than maximum strain.
Minimum strain greater than ultimate concrete strain.
Maximum strain greater than ultimate steel strain.
Minimum strain greater than ultimate steel strain.
Rotation angle should be in the range between 0 and 2.0*Pi.

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.RCSolver.SolveForces(Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.ResultType,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates resistance forces according to acting strain
member.param: Determines which type of resistance to be returned: for rebar, concrete or equivalent section (transformed).

Strain at the top of the section (on the extreme point of cross-section on the positive side of y axis).
Unit: [dimensionless].

Strain at the bottom of section (on extreme point of cross-section on the negative side of y axis).
Unit: [dimensionless].
member.remarks:
The resistance forces could be read by GetInternalForces method.
Top and Bottom mean points of cross section with the maximum and minimum y coordinate.
Other information about state of failure could be read using dedicated methods.
member.exception: Top strain greater than ultimate concrete strain.
Bottom strain greater than ultimate concrete strain.
Top strain greater than ultimate steel strain.
Bottom strain greater than ultimate steel strain.

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.RCSolver.SolveResistanceF(System.Double,Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Axis,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Calculates resistance moment according to acting design moment
member.param:
The acting moment.
Unit: [force*length].
Determinates which beanding moment is acting around x-axis or y-axis.
Determinates singn of result. Resistance axial force should be calculate as negative or positive.
member.remarks:
The design forces are described in the coordinate system x'y'.
The coordinate system x'y' has for origin (0,0) the gravity center of the cross section.
The x' axis is parallel to the x axis in which the Geometry and Rebars have been defined.
The y' axis is parallel to the y axis in which the Geometry and Rebars have been defined.
resistanceMoment - The bending moment. The axis around moment was calculated is determined by BendingMomentDefinition.
The resistance moment is the same as acting moment, the moment on the second direction is equal 0.0.
The resistance forces could be read by GetInternalForces method.
Other information about state of failure could be read using dedicated methods.
The units should be consistent for concrete, steel, geometry and internal forces.
member.exception: Internal error in the SolveResistanceF method

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.RCSolver.SolveResistanceM(System.Double,Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Axis,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Calculates resistance moment according to acting design axial forces.
member.param:
The acting axial force.
Unit: [force].
Determinates which beanding moment is acting. Bending around x-axis or y-axis.
Determinates singn of result. Resistance bending moment should be calculate as negative or positive.
member.remarks:
The forces are described in the coordinate system x'y'.
The coordinate system x'y' has for origin (0,0) the gravity center of the cross section.
The x' axis is parallel to the x axis in which the Geometry and Rebars have been defined.
The y' axis is parallel to the y axis in which the Geometry and Rebars have been defined.
The resistance axial force are the same as acting forces, the moment on the second direction is equal 0.0; The positive axial force gives compression. The resistance forces could be read by GetInternalForces method.
Other information about state of failure could be read using dedicated methods.
The units should be consistent for concrete, steel, geometry and internal forces.
member.exception: Internal error in the SolveResistanceM method

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.RCSolver.SolveResistance(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates resistance according to acting design forces
member.param:
The acting design axial force.
Unit: [force].

The acting design moment around x-axis.
Unit: [force*length].

The acting design moment around y-axis.
Unit: [force*length]
member.remarks:
The forces are described in the coordinate system x'y'.
The coordinate system x'y' has for origin (0,0) the gravity center of the cross section.
The x' axis is parallel to the x axis in which the Geometry and Rebars have been defined.
The y' axis is parallel to the y axis in which the Geometry and Rebars have been defined.
designAxialForce - Axial force. The compresion have positive sign.
designMomentX - The bending moment around x'-axis.
designMomentY - The bending moment around y'-axis.
The resistance forces could be read by GetInternalForces method.
The resistance force has the same eccentricities than acting forces.
Other information about state of failure could be read using dedicated methods.
The units should be consistent for concrete, steel, geometry and internal forces.
member.exception: Internal error in the SolveResistance method

member.summary: Gets the copy ofparameters describing steel behaviors.
member.returns: Gets the copy of Steel object.

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.RCSolver.SetSteel(Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Steel)
member.summary: Sets necessary parameters describing reinforcement steel behaviors.
member.param: The Steel object.
member.exception: The steel strength must be greater than 0.0.
The steel strain at failure must be greater than 0.0.
The steel modulus of elasticity (Young modulus) must greater than 0.0.
The hardening factor for inclined top branch must be greater than 1.0 , for horizontal branch must be equal 1.0.
The steel strain at failure can't be less than the design strength divided by modulus of elasticity.

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.RCSolver.GetConcrete
member.summary: Gets the copy of parameters describing concrete behavior.
member.returns: Gets the copy of Concrete object.

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.RCSolver.SetConcrete(Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Concrete)
member.summary: Sets necessary parameters describing concrete behaviors.
member.param: The Concrete object.
member.exception: The concrete strength must be greater than 0.0.
The concrete strain at failure must be greater than 0.0.
The concrete modulus of elasticity (Young modulus) must greater than 0.0.
The power should be greater than 1.0.
The reduction factor of the compression zone height must be in the range between 0 and 1.0.
The power must be greater than 1.0.
The relationship changeover must be less than the ultimate strain.

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.SetOfForces.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: The SetOfForces class constructor with AxialForce, MomentX and MomentY values set as parameter.
member.param:
The axial force.
Unit: [force].

The bending moment around x-axis.
Unit: [force*length].

The bending moment around y-axis.
Unit: [force*length].
member.remarks:
The internal forces are described in coordinate system x'y'.
The coordinate system x'y' has for origin (0,0) the gravity center of the cross section.
The x' axis is parallel to the x axis in which the Geometry and Rebars have been defined.
The y' axis is parallel to the y axis in which the Geometry and Rebars have been defined.
AxialForce(N) - The compresion have positive sign.
MomentX(Mx) - The bending moment around x'-axis.
MomentY(My) - The bending moment around y'-axis.
The units should be consistent for concrete, steel, geometry and internal forces.

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.SetOfForces.#ctor
member.summary: The default SetOfForces class constructor.
member.remarks: All internal forces are set to 0.0.

member.name: F:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.SetOfForces.MomentY
member.summary: The MomentY field represents the bending moment around y'-axis.

member.name: F:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.SetOfForces.MomentX
member.summary: The MomentX field represents the bending moment around x'-axis.

member.name: F:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.SetOfForces.AxialForce
member.summary: The AxialForce field represents the axial force (N). The compresion have positive sign.

member.name: T:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.SetOfForces
member.summary: Describes the set of internal forces: AxialForce(N), MomentX(Mx) and MomentY(My).
member.remarks:
The internal forces are described in coordinate system x'y'.
The coordinate system x'y' has for origin (0,0) the gravity center of the cross section.
The x' axis is parallel to the x axis in which the Geometry and Rebars have been defined.
The y' axis is parallel to the y axis in which the Geometry and Rebars have been defined.
AxialForce(N) - The compresion have positive sign.
MomentX(Mx) - The bending moment around x'-axis.
MomentY(My) - The bending moment around y'-axis.

member.name: T:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.ResultType
member.summary: Classification of the type of results returned by the solver.
member.remarks:
Section defines a full set of results for the reinforced concrete section. It's a typical situation.
For Rebars and Concrete only results for the concrete and rebars are available.

member.name: F:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.ResultType.Section
member.summary: To be used in typical situation, when all results (for rebars and concrete) are required.

member.name: F:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.ResultType.Concrete
member.summary: To be used when only results for concrete are required.

member.name: F:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.ResultType.Rebars
member.summary: To be used when only results for rebars are required.

member.name: T:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Axis
member.summary: Classification of axis.
member.remarks:
The internal forces are described in coordinate system x'y'.
The coordinate system x'y' has for origin (0,0) the gravity center of the cross section.
The x' axis is parallel to the x axis in which the Geometry and Rebars have been defined.
The y' axis is parallel to the y axis in which the Geometry and Rebars have been defined.

member.name: F:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Axis.y
member.summary: y'-axis.

member.name: F:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Axis.x
member.summary: x'-axis.

member.name: P:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Concrete.ModulusOfElasticity
member.summary: The ModulusOfElasticity property represents the concrete modulus of elasticity (Young modulus).
member.value: Gets or sets the value of the concrete modulus of elasticity (Young modulus).
member.remarks:
Unit: [force per length^2].
Modulus of elasticity (Young modulus) should be in base units for example [Pa] or [psi].
Typical values are in the range between 25000000000 and 40000000000 [Pa] or 3000000 and 5700000 [psi].
This value is used for the calculation of equivalent (transformed) characteristic of the reinforced section.
The return value will be in the same unit which has been used for strength measurement and should be consistent with units used to define concrete, steel, geometry and internal forces.
member.exception: The concrete Young modulus (modulus of elasticity) must be greater than 0.0.

member.name: P:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Concrete.Power
member.summary: The Power property represents the power for an power-linar stress-strain relationship.
member.value: Gets or sets power for an power-linar stress-strain relationship.
member.remarks:
Unit: [dimensionless].
Power parameter is taken into account only for power-linar relationship.
Typical values are in the range between 1.4 and 2.0. When power is equal to 2.0, a better approach is to use the parabola-rectangle relationship.
member.exception: The poawe should be greater than 1.0.

member.name: P:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Concrete.StrainRelationChangeOver
member.summary: The StrainRelationChangeOver property represents the strain which changes the type of stress-strain relationship.
member.value: Gets or sets the value of the concrete strain which changes the type of stress-strain relationship.
member.remarks:
Unit: [dimensionless].
StrainRelationChangeOver parameter is taken into account only for models with more than one stress-strain relationships:
- Linear-rectangle.
- Parabola-rectangle.
- Exponential-rectangle.
Typical values are in the range between 0.00175 and 0.0026. .
member.exception: The relationship changeover must be greater than 0.0

member.name: P:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Concrete.StrainUltimateLimit
member.summary: The StrainUltimateLimit property represents the value of maximum strain.
member.value: Gets or sets the value of the concrete strain at failure. Unit: [dimensionless].
member.remarks: StrainUltimateLimit parameter is taken into account for all models. Typical values are in the range between 0.0028 and 0.0035.
member.exception: The concrete strain at failure must be greater than 0.0.

member.name: P:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Concrete.EffectiveHeightReductionFactor
member.summary: The EffectiveHeightReductionFactor property represents the reduction factor of the compression zone height.
member.value: Gets or sets the reduction factor of the compression zone height.
member.remarks:
Unit: [dimensionless].
This parameter is taken into account only for a simplified model with rectangular stress distribution StressDiagType.Rectangular.
Typical values are in the range between 0.8 and 1.0.
member.exception: Reduction factor of the compression zone must be in the range between 0 and 1.0.

member.name: P:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Concrete.DesignStrength
member.summary: The DesignStrength property represents the design strenght of concrete.
member.value: Gets or sets concrete design strength
member.remarks:
Unit: [force per length^2].
Concrete design strength should be in base units for example [Pa] or [psi].
Typical values are in the range between 1000000 and 6000000 [Pa] or 3000 and 10000 [psi].
The return value will be in the same unit which has been used for strength measurement and should be consistent with units used to define concrete, steel, geometry and internal forces.
member.exception: The concrete strength must be greater than 0.0.

member.name: P:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Concrete.StrainStressModel
member.summary: The StrainStressModel property represents the type of stress-strain relationship.
member.value: Gets or sets the type of stress-strain relationship.
member.remarks:
Available stress-strain relationship are described by the StressDiagType enumeration.
For ULS, most common used relationships are rectangular and parabolic.
For SLS, most common used relationship is linear.
All the parameters required by the choosen relationship should be set using dedicated methods:
SetStrainStressModelRectangular
SetStrainStressModelLinear
SetStrainStressModelParabolicRectangular
SetStrainStressModelBiLinear
member.exception: Unsupported stress-strain relationship.

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Concrete.SetStrainStressModelPowerRectangular(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets all appropriate parameters for a power-rectangle stress-strain relationship.
member.param:
The concrete design strength.
Unit: [force per length^2].

The concrete strain at failure.
Unit: [dimensionless].

The concrete modulus of elasticity (Young modulus).
Unit: [force per length^2]

The concrete strain value which changes the type of stress-strain relationship.
Unit: [dimensionless].

The power for power function of stress-strain (1.0 - strain^power) relationship.
Unit: [dimensionless].
member.remarks:
The parameters should be defined in base units for example [m],[N], or [pound],[in].
All set values for concrete, steel, geometry and internal forces should have some consistent units.

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Concrete.SetStrainStressModelBiLinear(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets all appropriate parameters for a bi-linear stress-strain relationship.
member.param:
The concrete design strength.
Unit: [force per length^2].

The concrete strain at failure.
Unit: [dimensionless].

The concrete modulus of elasticity (Young modulus).
Unit: [force per length^2]

The concrete strain value which changes the type of stress-strain relationship.
Unit: [dimensionless].
member.remarks:
The parameters should be defined in base units for example [m],[N], or [pound],[in].
All set values for concrete, steel, geometry and internal forces should have some consistent units.

member.summary: Sets all appropriate parameters for a parabola-rectangle stress-strain relationship.
member.param:
The concrete design strength.
Unit: [force per length^2].

The concrete strain at failure.

member.remarks:

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Concrete.SetStrainStressModelLinear(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets all appropriate parameters for a linear stress-strain relationship.
member.param:
The concrete design strength.
Unit: [force per length^2].

The concrete strain at failure.
Unit: [dimensionless].

The concrete modulus of elasticity (Young modulus).
Unit: [force per length^2]
member.remarks:
The parameters should be defined in base units for example [m],[N], or [pound],[in].
All set values for concrete, steel, geometry and internal forces should have some consistent units.

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Concrete.#ctor
member.summary: The default Concrete class constructor

member.name: T:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Concrete
member.summary: Represents the class for concrete behaviors definition.
member.remarks:
Including parameters of concrete and methods for calculating the stress in concrete for a given strain.
The parameters should be defined in base units for example [m],[N], or [pound],[in].
All set values for concrete, steel, geometry and internal forces should have some consistent units.

member.name: T:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.StressDiagramType
member.summary: Classification of concrete stress-strain relationships.

member.name: F:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.StressDiagramType.PowerRectangular
member.summary:
Stress with Power-rectangle relationship to strain.
Power part (1.0 - strain^x) from 0.0 to strain relationship changeover value, constant part from strain relationship changeover value to the ultimate limit of the strain.

member.name: F:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.StressDiagramType.ParabolicRectangular
member.summary:
Stress with Parabola-rectangle relationship to strain.
Parabolic part (1.0 - strain^2) from 0.0 to strain relationship changeover value, constant part from strain relationship changeover value to the ultimate limit of the strain.

member.name: F:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.StressDiagramType.Bilinear
member.summary:
Stress with Bi-linear relationship to strain.
Linear part from 0.0 to strain relationship changeover value, constant part from strain relationship changeover to the ultimate limit of the strain.

member.name: F:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.StressDiagramType.Linear
member.summary:
Stress with linear relationship to strain.
Usage of the typical SLS model.

member.name: F:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.StressDiagramType.Rectangular
member.summary:
Simplified model with rectangular stress distribution.
Usage of a constant value of stress along the reduced height.

member.name: T:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.ConcreteExceptionEnum
member.summary: Classification of exceptions that could be thrown during creation of the concrete parameters.

member.name: F:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.ConcreteExceptionEnum.EffectiveHeightReductionFactor
member.summary: The reduction factor of the compression zone height must be in the range between 0 and 1.0.

member.name: F:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.ConcreteExceptionEnum.StrainRelationChangeOver
member.summary: The relationship changeover must be less than the ultimate strain

member.name: F:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.ConcreteExceptionEnum.Power
member.summary: The power should be greater than 1.0.

member.name: F:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.ConcreteExceptionEnum.StressDiagType
member.summary: Unsupported stress-strain relationship.

member.name: F:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.ConcreteExceptionEnum.ModulusOfElasticity
member.summary: The concrete Young modulus (modulus of elasticity) must greater than 0.0.

member.name: F:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.ConcreteExceptionEnum.StrainUltimateLimit
member.summary: The concrete strain at failure must be greater than 0.0.

member.name: F:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.ConcreteExceptionEnum.DesignStrength
member.summary: The concrete design strength must be greater than 0.0.

member.name: T:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Rebar
member.summary: Describes a rebar in the context of Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.
member.remarks: In this context a rebar is described by a point in the 2D space (Point2D) and his area. The rebars must be described in the same coordinate system as the cross-section geometry.

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Geometry.GetEnumerator
member.summary: IEnumerable standard implementation.
member.returns: Return standard enumerator for geometry points collection.

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Geometry.isClockwiseOrientation
member.summary: Check if the contour has a clockwise orientation.
member.returns: Return true if the contour has a clockwise orientation.

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Geometry.Clear
member.summary: Remove all points from the concrete cross section contour collection of points.

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Geometry.Add(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Adds a new point into the concrete cross section contour collection of points.
member.remarks: Points should be described in base units for example [m] or [in] and in the same coordinate system as rebars.
member.param:
The x-coordinate of the contour point Point2D.
Unit: [length].

The y-coordinate of the contour point Point2D.
Unit: [length].

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Geometry.Point(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a specific point from the concrete cross section contour collection of points.
member.param: Index of a point in the contour points collection.
member.returns: Returns given point as Point2D.
member.exception: Index must be less than Count

member.name: P:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Geometry.CenterOfInertia
member.summary: Gets coordinates of the center of inertia of the concrete cross section.
member.returns: Returns the center of inertia as a Point2D.

member.name: P:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Geometry.MomentOfInertiaY
member.summary: Gets the value of the moment of inertia of the concrete cross section.
member.values:
Returns the value of moment of inertia calculated around y' axis.
Unit: [length^4].
member.remarks:
The y' axis is parallel to the y axis in which the geometry and rebars have been defined.
The coordinate system x'y' has for origin (0,0) the gravity center of the cross section.

member.name: P:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Geometry.MomentOfInertiaX
member.summary: Gets the value of the moment of inertia of the concrete cross section.
member.values:
Returns the value of moment of inertia calculated around x' axis.
Unit: [length^4].
member.remarks:
The x' axis is parallel to the x axis in which the geometry and rebars have been defined.
The coordinate system x'y' has for origin (0,0) the gravity center of the cross section.

member.name: P:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Geometry.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of points describing the concrete cross section contour.

member.name: P:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Geometry.Perimeter
member.summary: Gets the value of contour perimeter.
member.values:
Returns the contour (concrete cross section) perimeter.
Unit: [length^2].

member.name: P:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Geometry.Area
member.summary: Gets the value of contour area.
member.values:
Returns the contour (concrete cross section) area.
Unit: [length^2].

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Geometry.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: The class constructor for a T cross section.
member.param:
The total height of the cross-section.
Unit: [length].

The height of the flange (flange thickness).
Unit: [length].

The width of the web (web thickness).
Unit: [length].

The width of the flange (top of the section).
Unit: [length].
member.remarks: The bottom left corner is in the center of coordinate system x=0, y=0 and the contour has a counterclockwise orientation.

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Geometry.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: The class constructor for a rectangular cross section.
member.param:
The height of the rectangular cross-section.
Unit: [length].

The width of the rectangular cross-section.
Unit: [length].
member.remarks: The bottom left corner is in the center of coordinate system x=0, y=0 and the contour has a counterclockwise orientation.

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Geometry.#ctor(System.Double)
member.summary: The class constructor for a circular cross section.
member.param:
The diameter of the circle.
Unit: [length].
member.remarks:
Internal representation of the circular cross-section is regular a 18-gon (octadecagon).
The area of the polygon is equal to circle (Pi()*diameter^2)/4.
The center of the circle is in the center of coordinate system x=0, y=0 and the contour has a counterclockwise orientation.

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Geometry.#ctor
member.summary: The default Geometry class constructor
member.remarks: This constructor could used to define a concrete cross section based on contour

member.name: T:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Geometry
member.summary: Represents the class for a concrete cross-section geometry definition.
member.remarks:
Including the description of the geometrical contour (section shape) and properties.
The geometrical contour is based on points in a 2D space (Point2D).
Contour must be defined in the same coordinate system as rebars.

member.summary: Looking for the envelope of two dimensional points cloud.
member.param: List of two dimensional points Point2D.
member.return: List of indexes points on the envelope.

member.summary: Class include static functions with the simple utilities.

member.summary: The Y property represents the y-coordinate of the point.
member.value: Gets or sets the y-coordinate of the point.
member.remarks: Unit: [length].

member.summary: The X property represents the x-coordinate of the point.
member.value: Gets or sets the x-coordinate of the point.

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Point2D.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: The class constructor for a Point2D. Creates a point with in x, y.
member.param:
The x-coordinate of the point.
Unit: [length].

The y-coordinate of the point.
Unit: [length].

member.name: T:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Point2D
member.summary: Describes a point in a two dimensional cartesian space.
member.remarks:
In the Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete, the two dimensional space is related to a cross-section.
The X and Y axes of the righ-hand oriented coordinate system with axis Z perpendicular to the cross-section.
All objects (geometry, rebars, internal forces) must be described in the same coordinate system.

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Steel.StrainToStress(System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates stress in steel according to the strain.
member.returns:
Returns the stress in steel.
Unit: [force per length^2]
member.param:
the steel strain.
Unit: [dimensionless].
member.remarks: Calculations takes into account the hardening factor.

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Steel.SetModelIdealElastoPlastic(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets all appropriate parameters for steel with horizontal top branch (Ideal elasto-plactic behaviour).
member.param:
The steel design strength.
Unit: [force per length^2].

The steel strain at failure.
Unit: [dimensionless].

The steel modulus of elasticity (Young modulus).
Unit: [force per length^2]
member.exception: The steel design strength must be greater than 0.0.
The steel design strain at failure must be greater than 0.0.
The steel Young modulus (modulus of elasticity) must greater than 0.0.
The steel strain at failure can't be less than the design strength divided by the modulus of elasticity
member.remarks: The values should be in the base unit and it should be consistent for concrete, steel, geometry and internal forces.

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Steel.SetModelWithHardening(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets all appropriate parameters for steel with inclined top branch (plastic with hardening).
member.param:
The steel design strength.
Unit: [force per length^2].

The steel strain at failure.
Unit: [dimensionless].

The steel Modulus of elasticity (Young modulus).
Unit: [force per length^2]

Value of the hardening between strain equals to design strength divided by the modulus of elasticity and the ultimate limit of steel strain.
Unit: [dimensionless].
member.exception: The steel design strength must be greater than 0.0.
The steel strain at failure must be greater than 0.0.
The steel Young modulus (modulus of elasticity) must greater than 0.0.
The hardening factor for inclined top branch must be greater than 1.0 , for horizontal branch must be equal to 1.0
The steel strain at failure can't be less than the design strength divided by the modulus of elasticity
member.remarks: The values should be in the base unit and it should be consistent for concrete, steel, geometry and internal forces.

member.name: P:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Steel.HardeningFactor
member.summary: The HardeningFactor property represents the value of steel hardening over the plastic behaviour.
member.value: Gets or sets the value of hardening factor between the strain equal to the design strength divided by the modulus of elasticity and the ultimate limit of steel strain.
member.remarks:
Unit: [dimensionless].
Typical values are in the range between 1.0 and 1.05.
Hardening factor equal to 1.0 means an ideal elasto-plastic steel with horizontal branch, greater than 1.0 an inclined top branch steel with hardening on plastic side.
member.exception: The hardening factor for inclined top branch must be greater than 1.0 , for horizontal branch must be equal 1.0

member.name: P:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Steel.StrainUltimateLimit
member.summary: The StrainUltimateLimit property represents the value of maximum steel strain.
member.value: Gets or sets the value of the steel strain at failure
member.remarks:
Unit: [dimensionless].
Typical values are in the range between 0.005 and 0.1.
member.exception: The concrete strain at failure must be greater than 0.0.

member.name: P:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Steel.ModulusOfElasticity
member.summary: The ModulusOfElasticity property represents the steel modulus of elasticity (Young modulus).
member.value: Gets or sets value of the steel modulus of elasticity (Young modulus).
member.remarks:
Unit: [length^4].
The steel modulus of elasticity (Young modulus) should be in base units for example [Pa],[psi].
Typical values are 200000000000[Pa] 29000000[psi].
This value is used for calculating changeover of stress-strain relationship and equivalent (transformed) characteristic of the reinforced section.
The return value will be in the same unit which has been used.
The units should be consistent for concrete, steel, geometry and internal forces.
member.exception: The concrete Young modulus (modulus of elasticity) must greater than 0.0.

member.name: P:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Steel.DesignStrength
member.summary: The DesignStrength property represents the design strenght of steel (design yield strength).
member.value: Gets or sets the steel design strength (design yield strength).
member.remarks:
Unit: [force per length^2].
Design strength should be in base units for example[Pa]. Typical values are in the range between 200000000 and 500000000[Pa] or 30000 and 75000 [psi].
The return value will be in the same unit which has been used.
The units should be consistent for concrete, steel, geometry and internal forces.
member.exception: The steel design strength must be greater than 0.0.

member.name: M:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Steel.#ctor
member.summary: The default Steel class constructor

member.name: T:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.Steel
member.summary: Represents the class for steel behaviors definition.
member.remarks: Including parameters of steel and method for calculating the stress in steel for the given strain. The parameters should be defined in base units for example [m],[N], or [pound],[in]. All set values should have consistent units. The units should be the same for concrete, steel, geometry and internal forces.

member.name: T:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.SteelExceptionEnum
member.summary: Classification of exceptions that could be thrown in time of creation the concrete parameters.

member.name: F:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.SteelExceptionEnum.HardeningFactor
member.summary: The hardening factor cannot be less than 1.0

member.name: F:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.SteelExceptionEnum.ModulusOfElasticity
member.summary: The steel modulus of elasticity (Young modulus ) must greater than 0.0

member.name: F:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.SteelExceptionEnum.StrainUltimateLimit
member.summary: The steel strain at failure must be greater than 0.0. The steel strain at failure can't be less than the design strength divided by the modulus of elasticity.

member.name: F:Autodesk.CodeChecking.Concrete.SteelExceptionEnum.DesignStrength
member.summary: The steel design strength must be greater than 0.0
